Phuoc on November 24.
Cuu Chi district police busted a case of
electricity theft from a medium voltage line with a
very large amount of electricity stolen.
Specifically, the district police dispatched the district police to coordinate
with the Cu Chi Electricity police to check at the
Company's branch in charge.  Ha Son Nguyen
Ngoc, a member of the company specializing in finishing
textile products, is located at Ap Bau Gao, Nhuan Duc commune, with
Ms. Nguyen Thi Minh Chau, who lives in district 11, as
the director. It was discovered that this company
was stealing electricity directly from the power
line.  The company's medium voltage generator was delivered to the company's low voltage generator
and then connected to the production system
consisting of four fabric houses and one
kiln. After initial investigation by the police department of the
Ha Son Nguyen Ngoc Limited Liability Company branch, they were  carried out
this act of electricity theft over a long period of time,
causing preliminary damage to the electricity industry of
billions of dong. The matter is being
further investigated and clarified by district authorities to
handle according to the
law on the evening of November 24. Police

buy things and then rob and run away are no
longer strange, but due to lack of vigilance.
Recently, a phone store in Binh Phuoc
had a young man snatch the phone and run
away. The provincial police are extracting the camera
and searching for it.  Arrested the
subject accordingly. At about 8:30 p.m. on
November 23, the owner of
Hong Dang phone store in Tien Hung commune was

young man in his 20s wearing a blue t-shirt,
jeans, and a mask.  Walking into the store,
after a few seconds of looking around,
this young man asked Mr. Thanh
to take the phone worth 4.8 million
VND to take advantage of the store owner's negligence.
This young man immediately took the phone.  The
phone ran away when Mr. Thanh discovered that the
subject had already run away. It was
reported that the authorities were taking
steps to investigate and clarify a
similar incident that had previously occurred in Tien Hung commune
in July.  The suspect, Phan Tan Hien,
parked his car and went in to buy a phone. Hien then
pretended to go to the car to get money to pay, then got in the car and
ran away. After 2 hours, the authorities
arrested Hien when he brought the phone to sell
at a store.  On
November 24, the
police investigation agency of Mang Thich district,
Vinh Long province, announced that it had identified and offered a
job to Tran Hoai Phong, 33 years old,
residing in Thien My commune, Tra On district, Vinh province.
This person shaved and edited lottery ticket stickers
into winning tickets to trick lottery agents
in Mang Thiet district to exchange
prizes for the amount of 81 million
VND at the investigation agency Tran Hoai
Phong admitted on October 31.  In
2023, Phong went from Can Tho City
to bring three lottery tickets that had been scraped and changed into
first prize winning lottery tickets to find a
prize agent on the way. Phong remembered an
acquaintance in Mang Thi district, Vinh Long province, so he
came to ask.  Then went to a lottery agent
in Cai Nhung town, Mang Thich district
to redeem the prize. After checking, the owner of
this agent redeemed the prize with an agreement of 10
minutes tax. Phong received an amount of nearly 81
million VND after deducting afternoon tax.  On the same
day, the owner of this dealer brought the lottery numbers to a
large lottery dealer in Tinh Vinh Long to
redeem prizes. He discovered that the above three lottery tickets were
very carefully cut and pasted.
Now, Phong's relatives have returned them.
Pay the full amount of 81 million VND to the owner of the digital
pricing agency. The
Mang Thich district police investigation agency is completing the dossier
to handle according to the provisions of
law in Tay Ninh, subject Do Anh Khoa,

In early June of this year,

is 900 km2, larger than the area of
this island nation.  The reserve will nourish and
provide the main food source for the
population of whale fish. The number of whale fish has been
decreasing significantly in the past 20 years, mostly
due to threats from humans
not only in Dominicana but also in the Dominican Republic.
Around the world, new reserves will

bring many other benefits, according to
Sal. Conservation of the whale fish brings many
